meanings.definition: To centralize excessively or too much.
meanings.sent1: The company made a mistake by overcentralizing decision-making, causing delays in projects.
meanings.sent2: It is important to avoid overcentralizing power in a single individual to maintain a balanced organization.
meanings.sent3: The team joked that the boss was overcentralizing so much, they might as well just let a robot run the company.
meanings.sent4: Overcentralizing authority can be like putting all your eggs in one basket, risking everything on one decision.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overcentralizing can lead to inefficiency and lack of adaptability in a fast-changing environment.

meanings.definition: The act of concentrating power or control in a central authority to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: Overcentralizing can lead to a lack of flexibility and innovation within an organization.
meanings.sent2: The overcentralizing of decision-making authority in the government caused frustration among citizens.
meanings.sent3: The overcentralizing of resources in one department left other teams struggling to function effectively.
meanings.sent4: The negative effects of overcentralizing power can be seen in the lack of autonomy among employees.
meanings.sent5: The dangers of overcentralizing control became evident when the central authority made a critical error.
